metadata.case_name: Khandu Sonu Dhobi and Bhikanrao Rambhau Khairnar v. State

facts.text: Dhobi (appellant No. 1) was agricultural assistant working under Khairnar (appellant No. 2), agricultural supervisor in soil conservation section of Government of Maharashtra.
Dhobi in charge of work relating to Bundh in block No. 13 of village Asane, Taluka Nandurbar, comprising survey Nos. 8,17,18,19,32 measuring 90 acres.
Bundhs constructed since 1962. Rectification work at cost of Rs. 369.07 to be done by Dhobi under supervision of Khairnar.
Government sanctioned Rs. 4779 for Bundh construction. Advance of Rs. 5000 received by Khairnar on March 2, 1966.
Work of value Rs. 4400 done, but rectification work not done.
Rules: Government spends first, recovers from landowners after completion report.
On March 11, 1966, Khairnar made entries in measurement book Ex. 27 showing checked 28 payments, certified, passed measurements, paid Rs. 369.07.
Paysheets Ex. 64 prepared by Dhobi, obtained thumb impressions/signatures of laborers. Khairnar initialled below.
On last page of paysheets, Khairnar signed certificate of payment Rs. 369.07 to PW 10 Jagan Trimbak.
Final bill Ex. 28 prepared by accused on March 11, 1966, signature of Jagan Trimbak obtained, signed by PW 7 Ziparu Tukaram and another as witnesses, then by Khairnar.
Debit entry Ex. 32 of Rs. 369.07 made by Khairnar in cash book.
Work abstract Ex. 29 prepared by Khairnar on April 16, 1966, sent to sub-divisional soil conservation officer Nandurbar showing expenditure Rs. 369.07.

Prosecution case: Measurement book Ex.27, paysheets Ex.64, final bill Ex.28, cash book Ex.32 false, fabricated without rectification work. Criminal breach of trust of Rs.369.07 with common intention to misappropriate.
Landowners complained to Sarpanch Tanku Bhagwan (PW12). Tanku sent telegram April 12, 1966 to superintending agricultural officer, Bombay division, Nasik.
Copy of telegram sent to D.S.D. Ghate (PW1). Ghate inspected block 13 on May 2, 1966, found no rectification work despite entries. Report May 6, 1966 for departmental action.
Superintending officer directed P. Inamdar (PW11) to verify. Inamdar and Ghate visited May 11, 1966, found no rectification work, no pits despite 83 pits in measurement book.
Inamdar report May 18, 1966 affirming no work.
Sarpanch complaint Ex.84 dated April 30, 1966 to director anti-corruption branch re false bill, misappropriation.
Director sent copy to SI K.G. Patil (PW13), Dhulia office. Patil local enquiry, took possession of documents.
Director directed Patil to register case. Patil recorded Inamdar statement Ex.79 Nov 7, 1966, sent to Nandurbar PS. Case registered Nov 8, 1966.
Nov 12, 1966, SI Patil applied for s.5A permission, granted by JMFC Nandurbar same day.
Patil transferred, successors Mahamuni/Kulkarni investigated with permission. Sanction Ex.97 by superintending officer May 18, 1967 u/s 6 PC Act.
Accused admitted in statements: work not done till March 11, 1966, no payments to laborers despite signatures/thumb marks on paysheets.
Accused defence: Prepared documents per instructions of Ghate (PW1) to send completion report for recovery. Rectification work done May 13-16, 1966, amount disbursed May 16, 1966.

Special judge: No payment, no work, documents false even per admissions. Explanation re Ghate rejected. Objections on investigation illegality and time bar u/s 23 Land Improvement Schemes Act repelled. Convicted.
High Court affirmed findings.
Supreme Court: No dispute on entries/documents March 11, 1966 re work done/payment. No payment March/April 1966. No work till May 11, 1966 per PW1/PW11. No pits found.

legal_issues.text: Whether accused prepared false documents and committed criminal breach of trust re Rs.369.07 without doing rectification work.
Whether accused guilty of criminal misconduct u/s 5 Prevention of Corruption Act.
Whether subsequent completion of work in May 1966 absolves criminal liability for false documents and misappropriation.
Whether investigation illegal for lack of prior s.5A permission, causing prejudice.
Whether prosecution barred by time u/s 23 Bombay Land Improvement Schemes Act, 1942.

petitioner_arguments.text: Rectification work completed after May 11, 1966; documents prepared per Ghate's instructions to enable completion report for recovery.
Even if work done later, no criminal liability as money disbursed subsequently.
Investigation illegal: Pre-registration enquiry by SI Patil was investigation without s.5A permission granted Nov 12, 1966.
Prosecution barred by s.23(2) Bombay Land Improvement Schemes Act: Must institute within 6 months of act (March 11, 1966).
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 23 Bombay Land Improvement Schemes Act, 1942

court_reasoning.text: No dispute accused made entries/prepared documents March 11, 1966 showing work done/payment Rs.369.07. No payment March/April 1966. No work till May 11, 1966. No pits found despite measurement book.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Accused prepared false documents, committed criminal breach of trust.

court_reasoning.text: Accused guilty of criminal misconduct u/s 5 PC Act in discharge of duties.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Agrees with trial court and High Court.

court_reasoning.text: No direct evidence work completed after May 11. Even if assumed done in May, does not absolve: Charge re false documents when no work/payment on March 11. Subsequent work not answer to false records/misappropriation. Explanation 1 s.403 IPC: Dishonest misappropriation for time only is misappropriation.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Willingness post-report does not undo offence.

court_reasoning.text: Pre-registration enquiry not 'investigation'. No prejudice shown from alleged non-compliance s.5A. Illegality in investigation does not vitiate trial unless miscarriage of justice. Court jurisdiction unaffected.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Cites H.N. Rishbud case: No miscarriage here.

court_reasoning.text: S.23(1) inapplicable: Not in good faith. S.23(2) inapplicable: Acts not 'done under' the Act but in breach thereof.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Acts in flagrant disregard of duties.

holdings.text: Accused prepared false documents, committed criminal breach of trust re Rs.369.07.
Accused guilty of criminal misconduct u/s 5 PC Act.
Subsequent work does not absolve liability for false documents and temporary misappropriation.
Alleged investigation irregularity does not vitiate conviction absent prejudice/miscarriage.
Prosecution not barred by s.23 Bombay Land Improvement Schemes Act.

precedents_cited.case_name: H. N. Rishbud and Inder Singh v. The State of Delhi
precedents_cited.relevance: Illegality in investigation u/s 5A PC Act does not vitiate trial unless miscarriage of justice; no prejudice to accused affects court jurisdiction.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Penal Code
statutes_cited.relevance: Conviction under these for falsification of accounts, criminal breach of trust, dishonest misappropriation.

statutes_cited.name: Prevention of Corruption Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Criminal misconduct in discharge of duties; prior permission for investigation; sanction for prosecution.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Land Improvement Schemes Act, 1942
statutes_cited.relevance: Time bar for suits/prosecutions against public servants; inapplicable as acts not in good faith or under the Act.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay General Clauses Act
statutes_cited.relevance: 'Good faith' means done honestly, even if negligently.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed the appeal, affirmed Bombay High Court judgment upholding convictions under IPC ss.218/34, 477A/34, 409/34 and PC Act s.5(2)/5(1)(d). Sentences of 1 year RI and Rs.200 fine (default 2 months RI) on each count to run concurrently upheld. No interference with sentence.

key_quotes.text: "Even if it may be assumed that the accused completed the rectification work in May 1966, that fact, in our opinion, would not absolve the accused of their criminal liability."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects defence of subsequent work curing prior offence.

key_quotes.text: "According to explanation 1 to section 403 Indian Penal Code, a dishonest misappropriation for a time only is misappropriation within the meaning of that section."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "It is well established that where cognizance of a case has, in fact, been taken by the court on a police report following investigation conducted in breach of provisions of section 5A of the Prevention of Corruption Act, the result of the trial cannot be set aside unless the illegality in the investigation can be shown to have brought about a miscarriage of justice."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Upholds trial despite investigation procedural issue.
